title: Lancaster police interview witnesses after gunfire strikes young boy
content:
Lancaster city police continue to investigate the circumstances that led to the shooting of boy in the 600 block of East Madison Street on Sunday afternoon.
The victim, who is 8 or 9 years old, was rushed by a private vehicle to Lancaster General Hospital after the 4:30 p.m. shooting.
A few hours later, doctors were preparing to transfer the boy to Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center, police said, because Hershey has more experience with pediatric trauma victims.
The boy suffered a single gunshot wound, but police did not release the location of the wound. Police also did not release the boy's condition.
Detectives were interviewing several witnesses to the shooting, which occurred outdoors, police said.
Police did not yet know if the shooting was accidental, intentional or if the boy was the victim of a stray bullet.
"It's too early to tell," Sgt. Phil Berkheiser told PennLive about 7:15 p.m. "We have all the players. They're being interviewed now."
Berkheiser said police hoped to release more information in several hours.
